intro: Acronychia ligustroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ghost gum, is a small to medium-sized tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing elliptical seeds. It thrives in dry to moist soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of northern Queensland and northern Western Australia. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
